intro: Hagnothesium, commonly known as the false hellebore, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Polygonaceae. It consists of several species, primarily found in temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. The plants are characterized by their basal rosettes of lanceolate leaves and clusters of small, greenish or reddish flowers. Hagnothesium species are often mistaken for true hellebores due to their similar appearance. These plants are typically perennial and can thrive in moist, shaded environments.
